text: (upbeat music)

- My team focuses on
helping customers migrate
their Microsoft workloads to AWS.

- Many times people think
AWS is not about Windows.

Like that's not something
that's a specialty that we have.
- We have been running Microsoft workloads

in the cloud longer than
any other cloud provider.

- We have a chance to work
with a different variety
of technology within Microsoft umbrella.
- I really love that I'm able
to help my customers build their vision
for their cloud journey.

- I wanted to move towards the
innovators within the cloud

and I see AWS as basically
the industry leader.

- Amazon has a reputation
of being builders.

- If you have an idea,
you can definitely take it

to the leadership and turn
it into an actual product.

I haven't had that experience
in any other companies.

- Building a diverse team
is top of mind for AWS

and certainly top of mind
for me and our team here.
- So having a diversified team will help
because our customers are diverse.
- We're not gonna be able to accommodate
and understand our customer's needs
without having diverse points of view
within our organization.

- Why I think AWS is an
inclusive employer is

because what we demonstrate
is not just about hiring,
but it's the investments that we make
in the different communities

and the different
cultures around the globe.

- I do feel like it really
is a truly a priority
at AWS to increase diversity.
It's something I see
as being a part of the hiring process
when I'm doing interviews or shadowing.

That's definitely something
that is a major focus
for leadership.
- What's really cool about AWS is
that we like to bring on talent

and that talent can
actually work virtually.
- It doesn't matter what your knowledge,
what your background is.
There's a place within AWS for you.
- The future is bright at AWS.
(upbeat music)
